Recommended Reason: Site of Thracian gold treasure discovery, one of finest ancient gold hoards
Supporting Evidence: 1949 discovery of 9 golden vessels from 4th-3rd century BCE, pure 24-karat gold

Recommended Reason: UNESCO site with numerous Thracian royal tombs and burial mounds
Supporting Evidence: Over 1500 burial mounds, ongoing excavations reveal gold artifacts and royal treasures

Recommended Reason: Ancient Thracian sanctuary and fortress with evidence of gold working
Supporting Evidence: Archaeological evidence of ancient gold mining and refining activities

Recommended Reason: Site of world's oldest worked gold found in Varna necropolis nearby
Supporting Evidence: 5000-year-old gold artifacts discovered, suggesting more prehistoric gold sites

Recommended Reason: Strategic mountain pass with potential hidden treasures from various periods
Supporting Evidence: Historical importance as trade route, site of multiple conflicts and potential hoards
